entry.content:
About Me

  • Full Name: Haichuan Zheng
  • University: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
  • Contact Information
    • Email: U202015059@hust.edu.cn

About Me as a Programmer

  • I prefer to use Visual Studio on Windows platform to edit code.
  • My programming experience includes writing about 3000 lines of GUI projects (as a course assignment) and simple CV projects using C++, as well as having some experience with Java and Python.
  • I have a lot of free time this semester and probably have a few hours each weekday to work on this project

About Project

  • Project Goals

    Our objective for the Transport Next Generation (TNG): Communicator plugins project is to implement and test new communicators for the TNG system. Specifically, we aim to achieve the following deliverables:

    1. Identify and select three new communication protocols for the TNG system.
    2. Implement APIs for each of the selected protocols that allow the TNG system to interface with them.
    3. Develop protocol-specific logic that enables connections between peers over each new protocol.
    4. Test the new communicators using a combination of automated and manual methods to ensure that they are functioning correctly.
    5. Provide a user guide and developer guide that clearly explain how to use and extend the new communicators.

    To accomplish these objectives, we will perform a literature review to research various communication protocols, analyze the existing TNG architecture, and develop integrations for each of the selected protocols. We will also conduct thorough testing to identify any bugs or issues that arise during development. While developing and testing the new communicators, we will document our work and ensure that our code adheres to best practices, to facilitate future development or updates to the TNG system.

  • Implementation

    To solve the Transport Next Generation (TNG): Communicator plugins problem, we will follow these technical steps:

    Conduct a literature review to identify potential communication protocols to implement in the TNG system. Consider factors such as efficiency, security, and scalability.
    Analyze the existing TNG architecture to understand how communicators will fit into the larger framework. Develop a plan for integrating new communicators into the system.
    Choose three communication protocols to implement based on the results of the literature review and the needs of the TNG system. Research the specifics of each protocol to prepare for implementation.
    Create APIs for each protocol that allow the TNG system to interface with them. This will involve developing data structures that can hold the state of connections and implementing functions that operate on those data structures.
    Implement protocol-specific logic required to establish connections between peers. For example, if implementing Bluetooth as a communication protocol, this step would involve implementing the logic for discovering and pairing with nearby Bluetooth devices.
    Test the new communicators using automated and manual methods. Set up a test environment that simulates different network conditions (e.g. high latency, low bandwidth) to ensure the communicators can handle real-world scenarios.
    Identify any bugs or issues that arise during testing and fix them. This may require changes to the core communicators code or adjustments to the TNG system itself.
    Create documentation for each communicator that explains how it works and how to use it. The developer guide should include information on how to extend or modify the APIs to add additional protocols or customize existing ones.
    Conduct code reviews to ensure that the code is properly formatted, commented, and adheres to best practices.
    Submit the completed work, including documentation, code, and testing results.
    The development and testing of the communicators will require knowledge in programming languages such as C and experience with communication protocols such as HTTPS, QUIC, Bluetooth, or WiFi mesh. Additionally, we will use Linux as the primary development platform, and utilize automated testing tools and manual testing techniques to ensure a robust final product.

  • Timeline

    • First month:

      • Week 1: Conduct a literature review on various communication protocols to identify potential communicators that could be implemented in the TNG system. Consider factors such as efficiency, security, and scalability.
      • Week 2: Analyze the existing TNG architecture to understand how communicators will fit into the larger framework. Develop a plan for integrating new communicators into the system.
      • Week 3: Choose three communication protocols to implement based on the results of the literature review and the needs of the TNG system. Research the specifics of each protocol to prepare for implementation.
      • Week 4: Begin coding the new communicators. This will involve developing APIs that allow the TNG system to interface with each protocol, as well as implementing the protocol-specific logic required to establish connections between peers.

      Second month:

      • Week 1: Continue coding the new communicators. Focus on completing the core functionality of each API and making sure it integrates properly with the TNG system.
      • Week 2: Begin testing the communicators using a combination of automated and manual tests. Set up a test environment that simulates different network conditions (e.g. high latency, low bandwidth) to ensure the communicators can handle real-world scenarios.
      • Week 3: Identify any bugs or issues that arise during testing and fix them. This may require changes to the core communicators code or adjustments to the TNG system itself.
      • Week 4: Run additional tests to ensure that all issues have been fixed and that the communicators are functioning correctly. Once all tests have passed, create documentation for each communicator that explains how it works and how to use it.

      Third month:

      • Week 1: Begin preparing the code for submission by cleaning up the codebase, organizing files and directories, and removing unnecessary code or comments.
      • Week 2: Finish documentation by creating a user guide that explains how to use the TNG system with the new communicators, and a developer guide that describes how the APIs work and how to extend or modify them.
      • Week 3: Conduct code reviews to ensure that the code is properly formatted, commented, and adheres to best practices. Use this opportunity to identify any last-minute issues or bugs that need to be addressed.
      • Week 4: Submit the completed work, including documentation, code, and testing results. Make sure to include a summary of the project, highlighting the key features and benefits of the new communicators.

• Month 1:

    Week 1: Study the architecture of CPAchecker and its different modules. Understand how control flow automata are used for program analysis in CPAchecker.
    Week 2: Study the theory behind control flow automata and their conversion process. Review related literature to identify suitable algorithms for backward conversion of control flow automata.
    Week 3: Implement the basic parser for control flow automata. This parser should correctly read in a control flow automaton in GraphML format, which is a commonly used format for process models, as input. The parser should also extract all relevant graph properties needed for the reverse execution function.
    Week 4: Implement the basic CFA converter that takes in a control flow automaton and reverses the execution direction. This involves creating new nodes for each edge in the original control flow automaton and reversing the conditions associated with each edge. The converted control flow automaton should be output in GraphML format.
    Month 2:

    Week 1: Implement a reverse execution function that takes in a program location in the converted control flow automaton and backtracks to the initial location. This requires designing an algorithm that traverses the control flow automaton in reverse, while keeping track of concrete assignment statements executed along the way. The algorithm should be able to handle branching statements such as if-else statements and switch statements.
    Week 2: Test the reverse execution function with a set of small programs containing different control structures. Verify that the reverse execution function outputs the correct sequence of assigned values corresponding to each visited program location.
    Week 3: Integrate the reverse execution function with CPAchecker’s existing analysis tool. This involves modifying CPAchecker’s codebase to incorporate the new CFA converter and reverse execution function.
    Week 4: Evaluate the performance of the integrated system using a set of benchmark programs. Compare the performance of our reverse reachability analysis with CPAchecker’s forward reachability analysis and evaluate the effectiveness of the implemented solution.
    Month 3:

    Week 1: Analyze the evaluation results and identify areas for improvement. Optimize the performance of the reverse reachability analysis by identifying and fixing bottlenecks or suboptimal algorithms.
    Week 2: Conduct thorough testing and debugging of the entire system to ensure that it is robust and free from errors.

About Me

  • Full Name: Haichuan Zheng
  • Language: English Mandarin
  • University: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
  • Contact Information
    • Email: U202015059@hust.edu.cn
    • GitHub Username: Beatrice-III

About Me as a Programmer

  • I prefer to use Visual Studio on Windows platform to edit code.
  • My programming experience includes writing about 3000 lines of GUI projects (as a course assignment) and simple CV projects using C++, as well as having some experience with Java and Python.
  • Python’s rich community ecosystem is one of its biggest strengths, whereas C++ and Java lack tools like Hyphen that can access Haskell modules.
  • Unfortunately, I am not very familiar with SymPy’s git.

About Me and My Project

  • What do I hope to achieve?

    I hope to use this opportunity to become familiar with large open source projects and to make my own contributions to them. I believe that the computation of Hall subgroups is a useful problem.

  • What excites me about this project? Why did I choose it?

    The practice of implementing abstract algebra theory using computers always excites me. I chose this project because it allows me to learn and apply abstract algebra theory, which is an area that I have been interested in for a long time.

  • What qualifications do I have to implement my ideas?

    I have studied basic algebra courses and read relevant books, which is sufficient to implement this relatively small problem. Programming is a combination of algorithms and data structures, both of which I have already learned.

  • How much time do I plan to invest in this project before, during, and after the Summer of Code?

    I am quite free this semester and during the holidays, and I can allocate 2 to 3 hours per day to work on this project.

我这个人

  • 全名:郑海川
  • 大学: 华中科技大学
  • 联系方式
    • 电子邮件:U202015059@hust.edu.cn
    • GitHub 用户名:Beatrice-III

我这个程序员

  • 我习惯于在win平台上使用vs来编辑代码
  • 我的编程经验有使用c++编写3000行左右的gui项目（课程作业）和简单的cv项目，对java和python有简单的使用体验
  • python丰富的社区生态是它的一大特色，c++和java就缺少像Hyphen能够访问 Haskell 模块的工具
  • 很遗憾我对SymPy的git都不甚熟悉

我和我的项目

  • 我想达到什么目的？

    我想要借此机会熟悉大型开源项目，并为此做出自己的贡献。

  • 这个项目有什么让我兴奋的？我为什么选择它？

    对于抽象代数理论的计算机实现的实践总是让人兴奋的。

  • 你有什么资格来实现你的想法？

    基本的代数学课程和书籍的阅读，我想足够实现这个不算大的问题。程序是算法和数据结构的组合，而这两门课程我都已经学习完毕。

  • 在编程之夏之前、期间和之后，您计划在该项目上投入多少时间？

    我这个学期和假期都很空闲，基本每个工作日都能抽出3到5个小时为此工作。

  • 请提供一份时间表。

    （用chat写）

entry.title: 采雷气
entry.content:
​ 今天武汉下雨，试了一次存想采雷气，效果还不错，感觉根宙斯老爷和因陀罗老爷打了个照面。

​ 然后心得是，要以中央为要，得一之后方可通达天地，然后就是经典的心佛众生（或者换成宇宙更好）三不二。

entry.title: 关于杰森米勒的高等行星魔法
entry.content:
​ 草草阅读了杰森米勒的《高等行星魔法》（当然实际上这本书也非常薄，可以说是小册子），49天的行星仪式可以总结为七行星的互具召请，从月下一直到木星。用到了奥林匹斯的咒文和杰森自己的符印。

​ 那么平替到密教。首先在做这个之前按照传统应该先完成了地神的悉地修行，平替到西方魔法那里应该是四元素仪式。这个暂且不论。假设我们已经完成了，那么下一步就应该是用虚空藏菩萨一步一步摄取七行星之全能。具体可以参考星耀仪轨诸经，一般来讲就是念诵虚空藏菩萨然后召请行星就是了，依然使用米勒的互具想法，做满49天，每天除了两个行星各10000+1000遍的名号，还要有虚空藏菩萨的根本真言。最后一天的时候可以来一个原汁原味的星曜大仪轨统摄一下。

​ 不知道能不能找到四元素仪式的模板，也平替一下。

entry.title: 昨天晚上听着萨满鼓入睡
entry.content:
​ 萨满教的通灵之物一个是迷幻草药，一个是八马之鼓。昨天听了bilibili上搬运的油管的萨满鼓，做了很久之前的一个梦。

​ 很久之前的一个梦是什么意思，意思是这个梦我在很久之前做过，但是后来不记得了。这个梦的主旨大概是一个场我和亲戚共同遭遇的灾难，然后有两个人关键人在众人之中可以打败灾难，然后我作为不是被选中的人但被选来迷惑耳目。充满迷雾的一场梦。我在梦中没有梦到这是梦。

​ 然后梦里还登录qq重新和群友说话了，这个大概是日有所思吧。

entry.title: 今天一开始身体没有力气
entry.content:
​ 昨天睡得比较早，今天早上起来大脑没有枯竭的感觉，持*之后感觉精神好了不少。

​ 但是一个问题是，身体没有力气，不知道为什么。一开始是一次没有练胸之后感觉无处发力，现在是浑身的肌肉都有一种不知道干什么，没有动力的感觉。

​ 下午的时候吃了藜麦+白菜+西兰花+鸡蛋+黑胡椒好了一点。大概是两种蔬菜的作用，其他三者之前吃的时候基本没什么感觉。

​ 再过几天编程之夏就要截止了，不能再拖了。明天早上把p90x练一半，下午出去泡澡，晚上回来就把要做那个项目补什么课想好，然后补完关键的做好申请书再睡。

​ 呃啊，好痛苦。

entry.title: 昨夜或者今天早上的梦
entry.content:
做梦，梦见复读。
梦到了经常联系的同学，梦到了自己一直暗恋却意识不到的人，梦到了为了不被老师讨厌撒谎，梦到了在刘备的演员面前高唱太阳神和长生天的名号。
做着这样梦的人改怎么走向未来呢。
